qas.question: Where did the Han dynasty receive their coin type from?
In what year was the decision reversing the closure of the government mint implemented?
Who released new lighter coinage that caused significant amounts of inflation because of it's weight?
In what year were private manufactures allowed to create coins that were exactly 2.6g in mass?

context: The Han dynasty inherited the ban liang coin type from <a0_0>the Qin<a0_0/>. In the beginning of the Han, <a1_0>Emperor Gaozu<a1_0/> closed the government mint in favor of private minting of coins. This decision was reversed in <a2_0>186 BC<a2_0/> by his widow Grand Empress Dowager Lü Zhi (d. 180 BC), who abolished private minting. In 182 BC, <a3_0>Lü Zhi<a3_0/> issued a bronze coin that was much lighter in weight than previous coins. This caused widespread inflation that was not reduced until <a4_0>175 BC<a4_0/> when Emperor Wen allowed private minters to manufacture coins that were precisely 2.6 g (0.09 oz) in weight.
